# touches(for:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the touch objects from the event that belong to the specified window.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func touches(for window: UIWindow) -> Set<UITouch>?
```

## Parameters

- **window**: The [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIWindow] object in which the touches originally occurred.

## Return Value

A set of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITouch] objects representing the touches that belong to the specified window.

## Getting the touches for an event

- **allTouches**: All touches associated with the event.
- **touches(for:)**: Returns the touch objects from the event that belong to the specified given view.
- **coalescedTouches(for:)**: Returns all of the touches associated with the specified main touch.
- **predictedTouches(for:)**: Returns an array of touches that are predicted to occur for the specified touch.
